meanings.definition: A phenomenon believed to foretell the future.
meanings.sent1: Seeing a shooting star is considered an omen of good luck.
meanings.sent2: The black cat crossing your path is often seen as an omen of bad luck.
meanings.sent3: The omen of a full moon on Friday the 13th made everyone laugh nervously.
meanings.sent4: The sudden drop in temperature was an omen of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The howling of wolves at night was an eerie omen of danger.

meanings.definition: A sign or warning of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds gathering in the sky were an omen of the impending rain.
meanings.sent2: The sudden silence in the room served as an omen of the teacher's arrival.
meanings.sent3: The loud thunderclap was an unexpected omen of the sunny day.
meanings.sent4: The broken mirror was an omen of seven years of bad luck.
meanings.sent5: The owl hooting during the day was a strange omen of change.
